name: The Lenox Hotel

reviews.text: We stayed at the Lenox for my daughter college graduation. We usually use Priceline when we visit, but because of the busy time of year, we booked the Lenox about a year in advance. At the time we booked, it was the best deal for a 4* hotel in the back bay/copley area.
reviews.title: Best hotel we stayed at in Boston

reviews.text: This is a lovely hotel and the service is about as good as it gets. The location is about a block from the T, and walking distance to many of Boston's sights, shopping and restaurants.
reviews.title: Service So Amazing I Will Never Stay Anywhere Else
Our New Boston Favorite
reviews.text: We parked at Prudential Central Parking with the coupon on their website for $25. I think the hotel parking was around $40.
it's no secret that I love the Lenox and that I stay there every time I''m in Boston. Here's just one illustration of why no other hotel in town compares.
reviews.title: A hotel that leaves us chocolate every night is my kind of hotel !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was in town to a midterm exam that required me to be on campus at one of the local colleges. The day of the test I was logged into my office on one computer and was also working on my personal computer trying to get some last minute cramming done before the test. I called room service for lunch. Victor, my room service waiter, notice my books, papers, and computers strewn about and we had a laugh about how busy I was. Later that afternoon Victor showed up at my door with a pitcher of hot water, several chamomile tea bags, cream, and sugar. I didn't order tea. He did this just because he knew I was working hard and he wanted to show that he cared.
reviews.title: A great hotel

reviews.text: I only booked The Lenox Hotel for Friday night since Saturday night I was staying with friends. I would have loved another night. The location of this hotel can’t be beat. 1 block from Copley “T” Station and in the midst of shopping, (Newbury Street is 2 blocks away), sightseeing and many wonderful places to eat.
reviews.title: The Lenox Hotel - My new favorite in Boston

reviews.text: I arrived a bit early and my room was not quite ready. So I dashed out to see the sights, and they phoned me as soon as my room was ready. They upgraded my room and put me on the top floor. I was surprised to see a air cleaner in my room but I was given one of the PURE rooms as they call them. They also had the foam pillows that I had requested already in my room.
reviews.title: Berkshire Concepts-Thank you

reviews.text: The room was very big for being in the city. It has a walk-in closet, which shocked me when I opened it. The furnishings were very nice, traditional as to be expected as the hotel is a historical landmark. The bathroom was a bit tight but fine for 1 person. Loved the Aveda toiletries and endless supplies of bottles of water which I needed as the room was dry from the cold weather.
reviews.title: quaint and luxurious

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: They turned down my bed and left Lindt Truffles. (The Lindt store is right next to the hotel!)
reviews.title: Five stars is not enough for this wonderful hotel

reviews.text: I stayed in December, so the hotel was festively decorated for the holidays. It really made me feel like I fell into an Old English Christmas book. I sat down in the lobby area by the roaring fireplace and read as it was so relaxing and beautiful.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Lenox for seven nights in April and loved the hotel. I can't say that everything was perfection--but what is?
reviews.title: A winner!

reviews.text: We had requested a top floor king junior suite (corner) in late February and called the day before arrival to make sure that request was noted, and it was. When we arrived, however, we were given a room (same type) on the 6th floor--which was not quite ready. We went to the Irish bar located in the hotel for a glass of wine while waiting. After a few minutes, one of the receptionists came into the bar, told us we would be upgraded to a room on the 7th floor that had a fireplace, and that our wine was taken care of. Though the 7th was not a "top" floor, we definitely appreciated the gesture.
reviews.title: Best find in Boston

reviews.text: Our room (700) was quite large and well appointed. The bed linens were luxurious. Unlimited bottles of water in the fridge were a nice perk, as was the free WiFi. We had a sofa as well as a chair and also a desk chair. Upon unpacking, we realized we needed more hangers, so we called to see if we could get extras. Within minutes 8 extras were delivered to the room. The service at this hotel, I think, is what sets it apart. Everyone was most friendly and accommodating.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: There is another bar in the hotel that attracts 20's and 30's. The music was a bit off-putting to us, so when we wanted wine in a nicer setting than the pub, we sat in the lobby--which was lovely. We ate one night at the City Table in the hotel and had a nice meal. Our waiter was wonderful.
reviews.title: Very good but not quite as good as I expected

reviews.text: The location of the hotel is perfect--only a block from the T, which we took several times. Most of the time, though, we walked--and walked--and walked---the best way to see Boston. Numerous restaurants are in the vicinity, so we didn't need to go far for our dinner at night.
reviews.title: Picked The Lenox over convention hotel.....

reviews.text: My mother and I stayed at the Lenox for two nights before driving west to the Berkshires. As always, I relied heavily on this site, but made my ultmate decision to stay here because of the ability to upgrade to a larger sized guest room. The room was very clean and comfortable. The service was perhaps the best reason to stay here. The front desk and especially the concierge service (Jason Lloyd) was very helpful and pleasant. The food at their resturant was very good, and well priced. Upon our return to Boston from Leaf Peeping, we had already chosen to stay at a different hotel. All the while we wished that we had returned to the Lenox. Thank you for making our stay so enjoyable.
reviews.title: Great Room, Best Servie

likes.disliked: — The beds could have been a bit firmer

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for three nights after having finished a cruise in Quebec and driven down through Vermont and New Hampshire for ten days, having stayed in several country inns.
reviews.title: Exceptional Hotel!

reviews.text: What a wonderful hotel! Great location in the Back Bay area of Boston. Right on the corner of Boylston and Exeter, very close to the subway and within walking distance of downtown. Very close to Newbury Street with lots of shopping and restaurants. One block from the Prudential Center.
reviews.title: Awesome Hotel, fantastic service in a great location

likes.liked: — room, location and making feel at home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room (819) was spacious, impeccably clean with large bathroom and a walk-in cloakroom with safe and a large flatscreen TV which was welcome in the evenings to see the latest financial and election news!!
reviews.title: Old World Charm with all the Modern Ammenities

likes.liked: — The well appointed rooms with lovely classic decour and plush furnishings

reviews.text: The check-in and concierge staff could not have been more helpful as was the rest of the service. Every evening a maid came round with an optional turn-down service, complimentary water and cookies.
reviews.title: Great Room & Location

reviews.text: I stayed at the Lenox last September and returned with my sister in July, 2011. She wanted to see the Red Sox, but let me pick the hotel. My stay this time was even better than last year. The service in this hotel is incredible. Every, and I mean every, employee is friendly and helpful. They do go above and beyond to make your stay memorable. Two of the desk staff realized my sister's devotion to the Sox and got her a special remembrance. Also, the concierge staff is wonderful. I needed help with a day trip and with tickets and they arranged everything. What I love is they do it without the attitude that they are doing you a favor. Instead they want to help and do so. If possible get a corner room. They are more spacious and are comfortable. Also, the hotel is within walking distance of Fenway Park and other attractions and you are very close to good shopping and good restaurants. If you are looking for a great hotel in Boston, this is the one.
reviews.title: This is a great hotel in every sense

reviews.text: We stayed here recently and, having checked out, my son was taken ill and needed a doctor before flying that evening. The hotel allowed us to call the UK to contact our insurance helpline, arranged for us to visit a local doctor and then provided some toast for my son when we returned to pick up our luggage.
reviews.title: Exceptional service and a nice hotel

reviews.text: Bearing in mind that we had already checked out this was exceptional service. Our room was a junior suite and very pleasant. The hotel is "pleasantly dated" but lovingly looked after and with very good staff it made a great place to stay in Boston. There's a "T" station half a block away with access to the Downtown and some good restaurants a block away on Newbury. Thoroughly recommended.
reviews.title: A very good hotel - excellent service and location

reviews.text: We stayed in the Lenox Hotel on Saturday 25 June and Sunday 26 June at the end of our trip touring round New England, before we flew home to London on the Monday. My wife, 10 month old daughter and myself made up our party.
reviews.title: We loved it and we went back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The service at the hotel is very good indeed, even before we arrived, as I exchanged emails with the concierge team with regards to a late check-out on the Monday and arranging a car with a car seat for our journey to the airport. They were extremely helpful and very responsive, and helped in every way they could.
reviews.title: Original room not great, upgraded room very nice

reviews.text: I chose the Lenox as the hotel for five colleagues and myself during a 3-day business trip to Boston. We booked an excellent rate through Travelzoo - $129/room on Sunday night and $139 on weeknights. The location was extremely convenient for our meetings, some of which were in the nearby Prudential Tower.
reviews.title: Pleasant stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, I was satisfied with my choice of hotel. Service was good overall, though I had just come from a brief stay at the Back Bay Hotel nearby, where I felt that the service was superior - more genuinely and consistently welcoming and helpful. Some of the staff at the Lenox were marvelous, others (esp. the housekeeping staff) seemed to be going through the motions. One evening when I was in my room working, the housekeeping staff knocked on the door and asked if I wanted turn-down service. I said yes, so they came in and went about their work while I was seated at my desk working on my laptop. They gossiped to each other quite loudly the entire time they were in my room. It wasn't a big deal, but it just seemed a bit intrusive and unprofessional. Also, that one night, they left chocolates on my bed at turn-down, but on other nights, they didn't. One day they didn't replenish toiletries as needed, so I had to call to get those delivered. When I first checked into my room, my TV didn't work - it turned out that some cable hadn't been properly plugged in in the back. I ordered room-service breakfast every morning, and one morning, there was no milk for the coffee; on another morning, the OJ I'd ordered was forgotten. To give the hotel credit, all these problems were rectified quickly once I reported them.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel with exceptional Staff

reviews.text: My room was spacious and very clean, but it had very little desk or table space. There was one very small nightstand, which was already crowded with a lamp, a phone and a large clock radio, so there was almost no room to put my own things there. The bathroom, while also very clean, had very little counter space. I spent some time doing work in my bedroom, and had to spread my work files out on the spare bed. The room lacked electrical outlets in convenient locations, so I had to ask the engineer who came to fix the TV to lend me a polarized extension cord so I could keep my laptop plugged in while working on it at the desk. Again, none of these things was a big deal, but just minor hassles. All the same, I was a little surprised at the hotel's No. 1 ranking on TripAdvisor.
reviews.title: Exceptional value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My south-facing room had a rather hideous view of the roof of an adjacent building, but it was very quiet at night - no traffic noise. Some of my colleagues had rooms with much nicer views, but they mentioned street noise being more of an issue, so overall, I was probably better off with my unattractive view.
reviews.title: Totally impressed with our first visit to this hotel!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: To balance the service lapses, I should mention that I also experienced gracious service from the Lenox staff as well. When sitting in the lobby waiting for a colleague, I was often approached by staff asking whether I'd like a cup of coffee or some water. Also, the doormen and bell staff were really helpful and efficient in summoning cabs, giving directions and helping with luggage. Overall, my stay was more than satisfactory, and while I might not rate the Lenox as Boston's #1 hotel, I wouldn't hesitate to stay there again, especially at a similarly discounted room rate.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay...cant wait to return!

reviews.text: I travel a lot, usually about 3 months of the year to Asia, US, Middle East. I say that in order to put some context on what follows;
reviews.title: Really excellent experience!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff at the Lenox were very welcoming and continued to be helpful at all times, the rooms were always clean and the whole environment was warm & traditional but with a nice mix of the modern (free internet, Ipod docking station, HD TV's) to make it a very satisfactory stay.
reviews.title: Customer service and location unbeatable

reviews.text: The location was superb with all of the major sights within walking distance. Shoppers have Newbury Street and the Prudential and Copley Square malls right on the doorstep.
reviews.title: Choice Location, Outstanding concierge service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I will definitely be staying here on my next visit to Boston and can honestly say that this is, Dollar for Dollar, one of the best hotels that I have ever stayed in.
reviews.title: Fantastic staff and great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Lenox for 2 nights for our wedding anniversary just before Thanksgiving and our immediate impression was the elegant lobby and how helpful and attentive the front desk and concierge were in helping us with sightseeing options. The service was impeccable, the best we have experienced in any 5 star hotel and the room with the fireplace was also amazing. On our first night the staff kindly left a gift of chocolates and red wine in our room for our anniversary which was a very nice touch and for our last night we had dinner at the hotel's restaurant - Azure. The food and service was equally enjoyable and the crispy pork belly fondue was delicious. Boston is one of our favourite holiday destinations and we highly recommend The Lenox.
reviews.title: Great location, outstanding service, stunning hotel!!!

reviews.text: I personally wrote the VP of the hotel about the service at this hotel. Not to ask for free things or look for special privilege at the hotel, but because the people at this hotel deserve the praise.
reviews.title: Do not stay anywhere else in Boston

reviews.text: By name of whom I remember
reviews.title: Simply fantastic

reviews.text: Kristie and Meghan at the front desk
reviews.title: Great service, needs some updates

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Peter and Mo Valet staff
reviews.title: Will never stay anywhere else in Boston

reviews.text: Other staff
reviews.title: Truly outstanding!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at The Lenox for the second last weekend of November 2008 and left just before Thanksgiving -- we went to Boston as a shopping and site seeing trip.
reviews.title: Quality hotel!!!

likes.liked: — Serive of highest standards in clasy surroundings
likes.disliked: — The queue for the bar Saturday night!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Loved it!
reviews.title: Excellent in all areas.

likes.liked: — The committment to excellence in all that they did.

reviews.text: Flew with BA out of T5 at Thiefrow, which was okay, but not as impressive as imagined it would be. On arriving at Logan Airport cabs were easy to come by and we paid $30.00 to get to the hotel which took about 20 minutes.
reviews.title: Incredible Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel had just been dec'd out for the holiday season and it was very classy -- we got a very friendly and proffessional welcome and our room was very impressive in terms of comfort. Not the biggest room in USA terms but had a big walk in wardrobe (which became handy!) and a 42" flat screen HD TV at the end of a huge King size bed. The bathroom was adequate.
reviews.title: Like a spacious apartment

likes.liked: — The large peaceful and charming room and convenient location ,

reviews.text: The Lenox staff are superb and nothing is too much for them - they get 10 out 10 for this.
reviews.title: Excellent staff, special mention for Christopher (guest services)

reviews.text: We (myself, husband and two daughters aged 18 and 21) stayed in The Lennox for five nights. We could not fault anything from the location, room or the very helpful staff. I give this hotel full marks!
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: Everything about The Lennox was perfect. The room was very nice, & the concierge was very helpful w/ restaurant selections, tour tips, & suggestions. We upgraded our July 4th reservation to include dinner w/ a view of the fireworks from the rooftop of the hotel. This is the way to go! We had a wonderful view of the fireworks & returned to our room within minutes afterwards.
reviews.title: Wonderful place to stay & location was perfect!!!

reviews.text: Wife and I recently stayed for two nights. We live in the area so knew the section of the city we wanted to stay in. The location is really perfect if you want to be in the Back Bay. Boylston St, Newbury St., the Public Gardens, Boston Common, Copley Square are all right there. And easy T access at Copley, too if you want to head elsewhere in the city. The "classic" room was very clean and nicely updated. Nice big HD tv, and the bed was quite comfortable. The room was fairly small by US standards, but we have certainly seen smaller rooms in Europe, so no big deal. The bathroom was our one gripe. The shower was too small for both of us (it was a couples weekend after all!). And we literally had to maneuver to get onto the toilet, and we are both very thin! The wall jutted out by your left leg, and the toilet paper roll sat over your left thigh. Very tight by any measure! All I can say is Zdeno Chara would not be able to use that bathroom! Even so it was a great hotel and we will definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: Great location with great service

reviews.text: The service and our room at the Lenox Hotel were phenomenal. They were very friendly upon arrival. Throughout our stay, many employees offered to help in any way. If you were waiting for the concierge, another employee would come over to see if they could help you so you wouldn't have to wait. The room was very nice. We even had a chandelier in our room.
reviews.title: Absolutely perfect from start to finish

reviews.text: The most amazing thing was how much they went out of their way when I got hurt. I stepped in a hole and twisted my ankle while at Boston Common and my foot swelled up immediately. I took a cab back to the hotel so I could put ice on it right away. I stopped by the front desk to ask if they could send up some ice. Not only did an ice pack arrive a few minutes later, but the man who brought it also brought a a basket full of treats. There were puzzle books, Clif bars, chilled water bottles, and Ben & Jerry's ice cream. This was such a considerate thing and made me smile after a bad morning. That is wonderful service.
reviews.title: Liked the Lenox

reviews.text: Stayed at the Lenox for two nights and my stay exceeded expectations. I was in Boston for a professional conference at another "major" hotel chain, but decided to stay in a more personalized location - and very glad I did.
reviews.title: Gem of Copley Sq

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the greeting of the doorman upon arrival to his goodbye two days later, I felt welcomed and at home at the Lenox. The King room was very roomy, wireless internet, large walk in closet with refrigerator, large bathroom with elegant fixtures, and large HDTV. Room was clean and the staff was very accomodating. I was called 5 minutes after check in just to see if I needed anything and if the room met my expectations - great service.
reviews.title: good hotel great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The conference at the other hotel was overbooked and one of my colleagues needed to find another hotel. I asked the Lenox if I could move to a room with two beds and they were very accomodating - even offering to move my luggage. They never hesitated in their efforts to make my stay enjoyable. The double room was just as nice as the King room - it even had a fireplace.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: So when in Boston, look up the Lenox, and if in the Copley Sq. area - definitely stay here instead of the Marriot's, Sheraton's, or Hilton's - I have stayed at each of these and the Lenox is cheaper and much better.
reviews.title: The Lenox made me not Hate Boston

reviews.text: we stayed here in october 2007- the hotel is in an ideal location to see Boston. some very good bars and resturants close by. the hotel offers a warm welcome at check in. the rooms were very well set out clean and a resonable size.the staff we found were helpful. we very much enjoyed our 3 night stay. although the parking charges were a little expensive. try the duck tour its good value for money.if we return to Boston which is possible as its a great city to visit we would stay here again
reviews.title: Ill be back to the Lenox!

reviews.text: Hotel was
reviews.title: Excellent staff so eager to please and professional

reviews.text: Definitely 4 star in service and rooms
reviews.title: Great hotel to stay in.

reviews.text: This was my first trip to Boston with two friends and to cut down on expense we decided to share a room. I phoned The Lenox and asked if a room with three beds could be arranged. They very graciously accommodated us with a room with two queen beds and a comfortable roll away bed. All this was on place on our arrival. The girls at the desk were most polite and helpful and provided us with tourist information. The room was first class with beautiful decor and the beds were most comfortable. We were provided with complimentary bottled water each day and chocolates with the turn down service. Comlimentary coffee and fruit was available from early in the morning in the lobby and iced tea and cookies in the late evening. Complimentary use of the business centre was very much appreciated. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the luxurious Lenox Hotel and would return there
reviews.title: This is a great hotel because of the wonderful staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have stayed here several times and always enjoy the experience. Our room is always comfortable and the location of the hotel is very convenient to everything in the city. All the staff from the valet to the front desk people are just terrific. The hotel adds little touches that are very much appreciated like coffee in the lobby each morning. We have visited the bar and the restaurant and enjoyed both each time. This is a fine place to stay.
reviews.title: Our favorite hotel in Boston

reviews.text: Great location, great service. Nice little bar. Have tried other hotels, will always go back to the Lenox.
reviews.title: Great location for old- style luxury!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed here with my boyfriend as a surprise for his birthday. I advised him that it was his birthday when I booked, and they left cheese and champagne and a card in the room on arrival which was a great touch-he loved it!
reviews.title: Excellent hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The reception staff were so friendly right from the moment we arrived. Concierge very helpful-nothing too much trouble for him.
reviews.title: Great Stay
Thanksgiving treat
reviews.text: Modern bar with good selection of cocktails and drinks. It was Christmas when we went, and the lobby was decorated beautifully. As it was below freezing when we went, the fire in the lobby was great.
Rooms modern and comfortable with great views of Boston. The location was excellent, pretty much next to the underground station and shopping centre.
reviews.title: v nice

likes.disliked: — small bathroom and no coffee/tea making facilities

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I love this hotel and would definitely stay here if we were to return to Boston.
reviews.title: Disappointed with The Lenox

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The reviews on this hotel are amazing, however they do the hotel little justice. All of the staff is amazing. They make you feel like you are the only person staying at the hotel.
reviews.title: Best Customer Service to be Found

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had 2 x Nights at the Lenox, Boston before the start of a New Eng tour.
reviews.title: "Good starting point in Boston before exploring beautiful New Eng"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: To be honest travelling from the UK & being slightly jet-lagged we were tired & it was great to arrive to a clean Hotel. But why is it you always persist in putting us Brits in a room right next to the elevator ! Noisy.
reviews.title: Touch of Class....as we expected
Great Hotel - Great location
reviews.text: Just back from a 4 night stay in the Lenox. We booked it (2 couples) based on the reviews here. To be honest, there is not a lot I can say about the hotel that hasn't been said already by other reviewers but here goes anyway....

Check in friendly and efficient. Nice Porter brought bags to our room. The concierge was extremely helpful (Jason) - he made dinner reservations, rental car bookings, gave directions, anything we asked of him basically.
reviews.title: Simply excellent

reviews.text: This hotel is incredible. Prime location nearby the public library and Copley place. So stylish and elegant, so beautifully renovated with such attention paid to every single detail of decoration everywhere, it almost looks like a museum. We loved sitting by the fireplace in the lobby. The restaurant is very nice (although we only had breakfast there) and the bar has a very unique, intimate lounge type atmosphere. Our room was quite large and comfortable, with numerous features which clearly set it apart from traditional US hotel rooms: elegant and stylish furniture, prime quality wallpaper, marble bathroom, Bose iPod docking station, safe, complimentary water, bathrobes, and a huge closet to store coats, bags etc. My only criticism concerns the beds, which were really quite small! I need to mention the staff, which was extremely kind and helpful. Great value for money!
reviews.title: Very elegant hotel, great value for money

reviews.text: I stayed here with my sons and was very pleased and felt very taken care of. I will never forget the staff at the door greeting us back "home" along with the wonderful women at the front desk. Their attention to detail was what made this trip so memorable. I was so happy I made this decision for our first trip to Boston. Our beds were more than comfortable and the room was quiet and peaceful. Feeling like your room is clean is very important to me. Even the best hotels I have stayed in are not this clean. Simply put, the hotel is beautiful. My sons and I quickly discovered the stairs which came in handy for me as I could burn off the yummy dinners we ate.
reviews.title: took very good care of me

reviews.text: Last weekend we had a three night stay in Boston at The Lenox Hotel to get together with my children for a certain"big" birthday of mine. I did not book online, as I prefer to speak to a person and get specific details about the room and location. Right from the start, on all of the calls that I made, I got nothing but impeccable, friendly, helpful service! Several days after making the reservation, I received an email (as mentioned in other reviews) offering to upgrade my room for $15 a night. I opted for that. Upon arriving we were greeted ever so friendly by the front desk staff (Rachel and Jamie) who upon my speaking said, I know who you are, happy birthday, we've upgraded you for free to a Junior suite, (what? wow! that's over the top on customer service!). After checking us in, Rachel asked if we had breakfast (we were able to check in at 10am, no hesitation), she then offered us a completely free breakfast at the Hotel restaurant. Breakfast ended up being better tasting than the other breakfasts we went to outside of the hotel.
reviews.title: Every bit as Great as the Great reviews we read...

reviews.text: The Hotel is lovely and very well maintained. The rooms are large and well appointed, with very comfortable beds and pillows, a frig, a safe, and a desk. We did have a fireplace in our room (as also mentioned in other reviews), with a big sign that said inoperable, oh well, it looked cozy. The bathroom was newly renovated and quite elegant with very nice toiletries. The hotel is quiet, we never heard anything coming out of any room and we saw how crowded it was- never would've known. The free water is such a plus- how I hate those $3-$7 bottle water charges for taking the bottled water in the room. The exercise room had nice equipment and a large selection of free weights, towels and more free bottled water, also never too crowded. The free wifi everywhere with no sign-in is also a big plus. There is free coffee and tea in the morning and afternoon in the lobby. The tea choices are very good, the coffee not so good..
reviews.title: Another Gem Often Missed
Really lovely hotel.
reviews.text: Justin, the Concierge, went out of his way multiple times to help us find the right restaurant for what we wanted to eat and how we were dressed. Everything is so convenient from this hotel. great shopping, one block to the T, really superb. At this point I'd really hesitate to stay anywhere else there was too much good here, I'd be afraid if I tried something else just to be different, I'd just be disappointed.

2nd visit and even better than the first. From the moment I arrived to the moment I left, I was treated like I was the only Guest. Doormen, Concierge,Reception and Housekeeping were really friendly. My room was spotless and I looked forward to coming back late at night for my 2 Lindt chocs(thanks for the extra choc).
reviews.title: Fully deserves it's No 1 Position.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If I had one minor quibble it would be the a/c. I was in room 920 and found the fan very noisy. I did not need the air so it was not a problem for me but it might be for some.
reviews.title: Luxurious Hotel...

reviews.text: Overall an excellent Hotel in a Fantastic City. I will Return.
reviews.title: Excellent experience in every way

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Lenox Hotel exemplifies luxury... The service was amazing.. Upon arrival, we were informed that we were upgraded to a luxury room with a wood-burning fireplace... The room was spacious with a grand chandelier... The bathroom was nice with Aveda bath products... The mattress was amazing... The television was new and there were books in the room to read... Overall, a great hotel...
reviews.title: Wonderfully Impeccable Service

reviews.text: If I could secure an economical rate, I'd move in like Eloise at the Plaza and make this my Boston home. It is a lovely, gracious hotel and the service is exceptional. Friendly, helpful faces and voices everywhere, and that attitude added immeasurably to the lovely physical facilities. Beautiful lobby, warm and inviting fireplace, fantastic location, first class environmental ethic---the Lenox has it all and I very much look forward to a return stay.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel with great service

reviews.text: This hotel has the most perfect location for a stay in Boston. The staff are extremely friendly and the ambiance is great. They provide tea, coffee and bananas in the lobby for breakfast, there is free wifi and the rooms are excellent, providing a great nights sleep. There is also a pub attached to the hotel for a drink or two. Highly recommended.
reviews.title: Top hotel

reviews.text: After staying at a number of hotels in Boston, I would have to say my top pick is the Lenox.
reviews.title: Overall The Best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The service was excellent. The Lenox has a large staff and all personnel are professional. The concierge . Kristi was helpful with some requests prior to my arrival. The front desk was very good also. The hotel is generally maintained in immaculate condition. They have a more than adequate gym as well as two restaurants and a nice bar.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: The location of the hotel is ideal for walking the city or checking out the numerous restaurants and bars in the neighborhood. Easy Access from I-90. Even during the marathon, the hotel ran smoothly and was never overwhelmed. Valet parking was quick and efficient.
reviews.title: Consistent yet varied.

reviews.text: The Lenox offers a great stay with class without totally breaking the bank.
reviews.title: Perfection!

reviews.text: Stayed in room #621 with two double beds for one night. Not much to look at from the room (one side overlooks roof of Lord and Taylor) but the light was good and the blackout curtains worked like a charm. A spacious room with comfy beds. Check in was easy and so was valet parking ($43 gets you until 2pm the following day). Had coffee room service and it was fast & polite. Ate breakfast downstairs in the café and it was good, as was the service. All the staff was super helpful – from check in to luggage guys to valet. The neighborhood is wonderful – tons of shopping at Copley and Pru Center + many restaurants. Now to the less-than-wonderful (and if I’d not paid $410 + taxes and parking, I would overlook these things – but a hotel at this level should get it all just right): The doorknob in the bathroom was broken. There was only one robe. No umbrella (they did have umbrellas at the desk in lobby). The clock had a dead battery in it. The ice machine in hallway did not work. Again, these are little things that would merit no mention at a lesser hotel. I would stay here again, but not for $410/nite.
reviews.title: Terrific staff, a bit overpriced, needs a little more attention to the details

reviews.text: The purpose of this trip was to celebrate my birthday which I do every year with my BFF, leaving kids and husband at home. (A Real Vacation) This year I chose Boston to visit and as always look to stay in a top notch hotel. Well Boston has several 4 star and above hotels within the same great location. After reading the reviews and comparing information, I crossed my fingers and selected The Lenox Hotel! It was the BEST decision, the staff at his hotel are well trained in customer service, their mission is to make sure the guest has a positive experience while staying with them. Even the maids are friendly!!! I went to the other hotels I was contimplating and looked at their rooms, I was SO GLAD that i chose the LENOX, after seeing the other comparable hotels, The Lenox won hands down!!!
reviews.title: The Best Choice!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The decor was magnificient, rooms very spacious, free continous supply of bottled water,free wifi, free coffee & tea in lobby every morning, turn down service with chocolates, fridge in room, 42 inch TV , cheerful and eager to assist concierge, hotel was very clean. The only downside I can think of is that I wished the hotel had microwaves in the room to reheat leftovers & have popcorn. However the restaurant was more than happy to warm up food for you. Everyone was very accommodating. There is no swimming pool at this hotel nor with some other hotels, so If that is majorly important to you then your out of luck. The location is superb, everything is walking distance and near public transportation. So to sum up my review of this hotel I will say LOVED IT, LOVED IT, LOVED IT!!! When my husband and I go back, we will most definitely stay there, no research needed.
reviews.title: so welcoming, I wouldn't trade this hotel for anything

reviews.text: My husband and I went to Boston for a 2 night stay without out 3 children. We booked our two nights at the Lenox through travelzoo and were not disappointed. Upon arriving from the airport, we checked in at the front desk. Check in was smooth and after telling the staff we had a rough flight-they asked us what we wanted to drink. Within minutes we were given a glass of wine and ice cold Boston Lager for my husband. Now that is great service! The next day we were headed to a Red Sox game. We stopped to ask the concierge about recommendations for dinner. He gave us a few suggestions, made reservations for us and then proceeded to give us 2 tickets for the Red Sox game. When we arrived back in our room we discovered a bottle of wine on ice along with 2 wine glasses. I am not sure if this is typical, or we just lucked out, but I wouldn't stay in another hotel in Boston after this service.
reviews.title: Great Place to Stay

reviews.text: Stayed in July with my wife and son. The entire staff was very friendly and helpful. You can not beat the location. Newbury street one block away the T one block away.
reviews.title: Doesn't live up to reviews

reviews.text: Spent 2 nights at the Lenox in Boston travelling with my partner & sister. Our first impression of the hotel was great. It was so welcoming and the service was fantastic. Our room was lovely - lots of character and very comfortable. It is not comparable to the other modern style of hotels we usually stay in because it is so different. We ate dinner in the main restaurant downstairs before heading over to the Irish Pub to watch #6 game in the Stanley Cup. The atmosphere was electric and we thoroughly enjoyed it.
reviews.title: Gorgeous Historic Hotel

reviews.text: The location of the hotel is great - right in Back Bay with an easy walk to restaurants and shopping. I certainly wish we spent more than just 2 nights in Boston and I look forward to going back again. I will definitely be staying at the Lenox when we return to Boston.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We also caught the train up to Harvard which was very easy and a lot of fun. Also caught the subway around to Fenway Park. I was very pleased at how easy it was to get around Boston.
reviews.title: Great location, nice hotel, good service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One of the best hotels that I have ever stayed . Very good service, location anad rooms . THe restaurants have good food and teh price was very reasonable
reviews.title: Affordable Luxury in Copley Square

reviews.text: A large hotel but a personal service. Nicely decorated in an old school style but all clearly new and well maintained. Large room and bathroom, comfortable. Good free bathroom toiletries etc, bottles of water and chocolates left on pillow each night, which was a nice touch. No tea/coffee facilities in room but they provided free hot drinks in the reception each morning,and there was a good sized fridge in the room to store food/drink (the only one in our 5 hotel holiday which had a fridge we could actually use!). We had a room with 2 doubles. Each double was too small for two people of any height or girth, so we just had a double bed each!There was a very friendly bell-hop in his 80's, who was quite a character, and the staff were friendly and helpful. Just a short, safe walk into the centre of boston. I would stay there again. I recommend 'Finagle a bagel' down the road for breakfast on the go!
reviews.title: Should be number 1 - really really really good!

reviews.text: We stayed during an exceptionally busy weekend that included the Boston Marathon and Opening Day at Fenway Park. The place was packed but the exceptional front desk staff kept things moving swiftly and kept guests satisfied. It's an older hotel but the rooms are nicely renovated. They are larger than normal, well appointed and clean. The location is also excellent - right near shops, restaurants, and the "T." Very walkable. Only problem was the wi-fit went out for a while one night but they had it back the next morning.
reviews.title: Excellent Property, Location and Service!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A 4 or 5 Star price for a 3 Star hotel. The biggest let down apart from the price was the Bathroom. Tiny, gloomy and poor shower (in the bath) water pressure. Breakfast offers a limited menu and not well cooked with not a smile from any dining room staff. Front of hotel staff were very pleasant including Kristie & Justin Concierge team who were excellent.
reviews.title: . A disappointment with the Lenox. Boston

reviews.text: Great locations with many walk to shops. Hotel personnel were friendly.
reviews.title: Visiting Son in College

reviews.text: Very pretty lobby and comfortable beds.
reviews.title: Fine + a few headaches

reviews.text: Stayed here for four nights. Good location. Had reserved a "Pure" room, only to get there and find out that they had given all of those rooms away. They made an effort to put an air filter in my regular room the next day. The air filter ended up making a crazy amount of noise. The room I ended up in was probably realign nice about ten years ago, but now is sort of worn.
reviews.title: Exceeded my expectations!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: there are many hotel managers who should go stay at this place and see how a hotel should be ran!!! Room was excellent, service outstanding and very well placed for local shopping etc, if i ever go back to Boston, i will be booking in here!!!!
reviews.title: Excellent!!!!

reviews.text: The staff at the Lenox hotel is amazing! Everyone is genuinely friendly and helpful. Boston was a bit cold during my visit and there was a warm fire in the lobby with complimentary hot chocolate and cookies. In my room was a cozy bathrobe and even an umbrella to borrow. The hotel is walking distance from Newbury Street with lots of great shopping and restaurants. I travel a lot for work and this was one of my absolute favorite experiences. I will definitely come back.
reviews.title: Amazing staff, wonderful location, incredible stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I were visiting our son, who goes to Emerson College. Since we are from California and didn't know anything about Boston before our son started college here, we try to stay in a different hotel each time we come. I cannot say enough great things about the Lenox Hotel. The staff went out of their way for us in every area. We stayed in a corner room with a fireplace, and had a wonderful view of the city. The hotel's car was available to take us to Emerson college when we it was raining and we didn't want to walk. They also arranged a car to take us to the airport. The workout room was small, but had everything we needed, and was spotless.
reviews.title: Wonderful service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Honestly, everything was perfect. Even though the weather was cold and stormy, it was warm and cozy inside.
reviews.title: A super charming small hotel...and close to everything!

reviews.text: We love the small hotel ambience and courteous staff. This is an older building, but nicely maintained so as not to lose its charm...although the bathrooms can be a little cramped. Great bar and restaurants on-site and close to shopping and other great restaurants. This is our hotel of choice whenever we stay in Boston. Love it!
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel excellent location

reviews.text: This was our second stay at the Lenox. The first stay was delightful which brought us back when we had a family event in October. I reserved a single for my mother in law and a small suite for my wife daughter and my self. I believe that if I am going to pay a premium for a room I should receive a higher level of service along with the room being above average. Service for us was spotty, a delay in having a room ready allowed the front desk to shine by buying us lunch. A further delay though understandable was not communicated us us and that off set the good feeling from the front desk experience. We finally asked for alternate rooms and after some conversation they were provided. It may have been the change of rooms because although we received the same room it had a number of flaws which for a premium property should be unacceptable. The smoke detector was missing, I called and I told the bellman. It was never taken care of during the four days we were guests. Holes in the wall where something had been removed - not for what bills it self as a boutique hotel. Having to repeatedly call for our bags - I was comfortable with them not arriving shortly after we moved into our room even though we were told they were on the way up. I was comfortable calling and asking when they might arrive. I was told the bellman was on the way up. I was aggravated when the bags still had not arrived and I started to get questioned by my wife and daughter. I was expecting and hoping for a premium experience and that was not the case. I called about what I thought was a noisy ventilation system - I don't believe anyone ever looked at it. We loved the location, restaurant service was very uneven, the doorman was great - the hotel just disappointed. To add insult to injury I receive an automatic e-mail from the general manager thanking me for my stay and asking me to rate the hotel. I was honest with my responses and even handed just as I believe I am here. I thought a quality hotel like this would at least respond to a critical response from a guest. It didn't happen. I like the hotel, I believe it could fix the issues so I called and asked to speak to the GM. There was no response so I followed up - at this point you have a right to say I'm the moron here. the GM's assistant finally called, set up a time for me to talk with the GM which I scheduled and then he never called. Several days later I had a voice asking to me to set up a new time. Enough said - I was terribly disappointed on a number of levels. It did not ruin the trip - it was one of those things where because I walked in with premium expectation and on a number of levels they were not met. I hope this helps guide your decision making.
reviews.title: Mixed messages

reviews.text: Stayed in this Hotel in August 2011 on a family trip to Boston and loved it. The room was very spacious with two double beds (which were very comfortable), a sofa, fireplace, flat screen TV and bathrobes. The staff were very friendly and helpful giving us plenty of ideas on where to sight-see. We took the metro from the airport and could not believe how close it was to the Hotel which made travelling around very easy. It is also within walking distance of lots of nice shops and restaurants. The staff went out of their way to make sure we were happy with our room on arrival. We had breakfast in the restaurant and late evening snacks in the Solas bar and the food was very good. I would stay in this Hotel again if I ever go back to Boston.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel

reviews.text: We really enjoyed our 1 night stay at the Lenox.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.text: We were upgraded to a junior suite with a fireplace which was a nice surprise. The room was very well appointed, with a desk, a sofa, and a fireplace that did not work. There's a big flat-screen TV, which we necer used and a Bose IPod dock that we did use. Bathroom was a little small when compared to the size of the room, with plenty of towels and nice toiletries.
reviews.title: Good location, friendly and personal service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bed was amazing and definately one of the most comfortable hotel beds I've ever slept in and the light-blocking curtains were a nice touch.
reviews.title: Old World Charm

reviews.text: All as we would have expected based on good recommendations on this site. We booked Exec King with fireplace -- these rooms are large corner rooms, ours was on 11th floor. Bathroom a little tired but ok.
reviews.title: Great location. Friendly courteous service.

reviews.text: This is my favorite hotel in Boston. I've stayed in many of them, Sheraton, Marriott, Weston, Copley, but this is the best. The best customer service you will ever find, the most fantastic bar and lounge, and the location cannot be better. One block from the Copley T stop. One block from Newbury Street. One block from the Prudential Building and one block from Copley Center.
reviews.title: The only place I want to stay when I'm in Boston

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The customer service will do their utmost best to provide you with what you need. If you're needing directions, a toothbrush or a banana, it's there for you.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is an historic hotel, so be prepared for the carpets to be showing some wear and tear, but the fireplace in the room (if you're in a room with a fireplace) more than makes up for this. If you don't have a fireplace in your room, and you want to be near a fireplace, just go down to the lobby, there's one roaring away for you (in the winter).
reviews.title: Best location in Boston

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you want a mid-day snack or cocktail, try the Irish pub located adjacent to the Hotel.
reviews.title: Brilliant Hotel

reviews.text: Stayed 2nd December for 3 nights.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: Our two queen bedded rooms were spacious. We were on the 4th floor with a good view of the city.
reviews.title: Charming, immaculate and perfectly located.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were friendly and the rooms were very clean.
reviews.title: The Lenox is wonderful!

reviews.text: Hotel is well located for shopping and sightseeing who could ask for more?
reviews.title: We felt regal
Top notch service at an exquisite hotel!
reviews.text: Stayed here on various occasion 6-7 years ago and I have to say the Hotel had not lost its genuine old world charm during this stay. Immaculate throughout from the small lobby, to the upmarket City bar and the ever so smart tall ceilined but expensive Azure restaurant where on this visit was a dissappointment which must have shown on my face as the appetizer was removed from the bill without me saying a word so maybe this was a one off.

Stayed at the Lenox for four nights over Halloween. It's a great Boston option. We had a superior room with two double beds which was really comfortable. It was impeccably clean and a pleasure to stay in.
reviews.title: The business!

reviews.text: The service you receive from reception, concierge and housekeeping is great; really friendly and helpful staff. I think the people at the Lenox go a long way to bump the hotel up from Above Average to Excellent!
reviews.title: The best hotel experience we have ever had

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location wise it's really convenient to shopping with options all around from Newbury Street to Marshalls/Filenes Basement and various malls with Saks, Barneys etc. We walked the short distance through the park to all the sights on the Freedom Trail etc.
reviews.title: Excellent Service and Location

reviews.text: Some people have a gym high on their list of priorities so I'll mention that the gym is really small, stuffy and unappealling.
reviews.title: Great Hotel in a Great City

likes.disliked: — no tea and coffe factilites in room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Also no tea/coffee making facilities in the rooms, but tea/coffee available in the lobby in the morning.
reviews.title: One of the best in the country....

likes.disliked: — I can't think of a single thing.

reviews.text: I enjoyed the beautiful room and restaurants in this historic hotel. The hotel staff made the experience even better with their friendly and helpful service. I will make sure I stay at the Lenox Hotel again the next time I visit Boston.
reviews.title: fantastic service
Staying at the Lenox Hotel was such a treat! BEAUTIFUL & Lavish!
reviews.text: Staying @ the Lenox Hotel in Boston was such a treat! We were greeted by quick/efficient valets & concierge. The property and decor is gorgeous, like a super-charged Providence Biltmore. Upon entering our rooms there was a gift basket with all sorts of mouth-watering delights and a hand written note welcoming us. Our room was spacious, extremely well-maintained and cozy. I highly recommend the Lenox Hotel in Boston as an alternative to the regular/normal hotels you can get anywhere in the US. This is truly an exclusive Boston experience!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I spent the weekend at the Lenox back in April, and returned again recently for cocktails at City Bar. It is such a charming, historic hotel, and the recent renovations to the Lobby look AMAZING! So classy and clean, and the staff is very friendly and accomodating! My room was clean, spatious, and inviting, and the service was top notch..and GREEN- which I totally appreciate.
reviews.title: Clean, classy, lovely, and friendly!
Would highly recommend the Lenox!
reviews.text: One day the weather was terrible, so we stayed in the hotel the entire day- and didn't get stir-crazy! Between the good TV channel options, the great room service menu, the City Bar (amazing bourbon, BTW!) and Azure downstairs, we had a blast!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, the Lenox was a great place to call home during my weekend in Boston- plus, it's in the middle of everything, so I was a short walk to shopping, theatre, great restaurants, and the T!
reviews.title: Wonderful lovely Lenox

reviews.text: I stay at the Lenox Hotel pretty regularly when in Boston for business and pleasure. It's an older hotel with well appointed rooms and lots of charm. If you pay a bit more the rooms are very spacious, but even the standard rooms are fine. There's a lobby bar, an Irish pub and a more upscale restaurant (which has changed management and cuisine recently). The staff is unfailingly helpful and pleasant. Prices are moderate for such a prime Boston location. It's an easy walk to Boylston St or Newbury St. shopping, convenient to the Public Garden, Common, theater district, symphony and museums.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel in prime Copley Square area

reviews.text: I highly recommend The Lenox Hotel. Great location, top-notch accomodations, superb staff. We will definitely book again in the future.
reviews.title: Wonderful Stay

reviews.text: I stayed in a Classic Room at The Lenox for five nights in July 2009. My room was immaculate on arrival and was kept to a high standard of cleanliness by the maids throughout my stay. It was quite spacious, and there was a walk-in closet with plenty of space to hang clothes and store luggage. The en-suite bathroom was well-stocked with complimentary Aveda toiletries which were a luxurious treat. The furnishings in both my room and the communal areas were elegant with a stylish, rich colour scheme. My room was ideal for a peaceful night’s sleep – the bed was extremely comfortable and there was virtually no noise from the other guests or the street below. I particularly enjoyed having a refrigerator in my room to keep snacks and drinks cool especially as it was very hot outside. There was a turndown service every night which included tasty Lindt chocolates on the pillow and fresh bottled water in the refrigerator.
reviews.title: Perfect!

reviews.text: I had two minor problems on my first night: firstly, I could not remove the plug from the bath tub; and, secondly, I could not get an on-demand movie to load on the television. I telephoned reception for each problem and, on both occasions, a handyman arrived at my room within a couple of minutes to quickly solve both problems.
reviews.title: The superb hotel lenox

reviews.text: The hotel is located in the Back Bay area of Boston and, as the city centre is so easy to get around on foot, it is ideally situated. There were plenty of shops and restaurants nearby, and the Lindt chocolate shop underneath the hotel was very convenient!
reviews.title: Excellent, highly recommend.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We really enjoyed the evening that we spent at this hotel. It is old fashioned splendour. Room was nice and big with a fabulous bed. The bathroom could have done with some updating, and it would have been useful to have a safe in the room, but apart from those things, we really enjoyed our stay here and would recommend this hotel
reviews.title: Old Fashioned Splendour

reviews.text: We were traveling with our 16 yr old daughter and we stayed in a junior suite on the 4th floor. The room was a great size with two large doubles. Everything in the room was great and the fridge was good and quite so we could chill our drinlks. The room and bathroom were very clean and the maid service was excellent each day. All the staff were very friendly and helpful. The location is very central in the back bay area with easy access to T line and trolley tours. In summary we would not hesitate to recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, great value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We needed an overnight stay in Boston between legs of a trip. This location fit the bill - quick ride to the airport, close to decent restaurants that would be open when we arrived (after 9pm) and reasonably priced. We found ourselves wishing we had more time to enjoy it... the hotel is lovely, clean, quiet, friendly and even a bit plush without being stuffy. We will definitely stay at the Lenox when next in BOS! Oh, and the "Irish Pub" had the best pub fare we've ever tried. Thanks!
reviews.title: Surprisingly nice overnight

reviews.text: This is a great hotel in the heart of Boston's Back Bay. Very close to Newbury Street shopping, good restaurants, and the Hynes Convention Center. The price can fluctuate depending on the room style, but the lower-end rooms are beautiful and on the low end of the price spectrum for Boston, where even ratty hotels can charge $300 a night. I've stayed at name-brand hotels in the city that felt more like a truck stop in the middle of Kansas and been bilked. None of that with the Lenox. This is a top notch hotel, luxurious even, at a very decent price.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel in the Back Bay, Great Value for Boston

reviews.text: The lobby is beautiful, staff was excellent, and the breakfast at City Table was top notch. This is a great place to stay in Boston.
reviews.title: Traditional classic Hotel. Older customers.

reviews.text: This was a superb hotel in a great location. The staff were unbelievably helpful, from the moment they greeted us until the minute they summoned our taxi to leave. They arranged the booking of tickets for a Boston Red Sox baseball game (which were unavailable anywhere else). Room was spotlessly clean, very elegant and worth the money. This hotel is number one on trip advisor, a title it deserves. If you visit Boston, which is a wonderful city, you should treat yourself to a stay at the Lennox.
reviews.title: great hotel

reviews.text: My wife and 2 sons (aged 13 & 12) spent 3 days at the Lenox at the start of July. We arrived from London quite late in the evening, fairly tired and forget our usual request at check-in - 'a room away from the elevators and ice machines' to avoid the noise. Our hearts sank as we got out of the elevator to see our room directly opposite. We thought about requesting a change but since it was late we thought we'd give it a go and sort it out the next day. As it turned out, we needn't have worried. We didn't hear a thing over our entire three days.
reviews.title: Perfect location with great staff

reviews.text: The front desk also sent up a complimentary basket of cookies,chips and chocolate for the children 'because they looked tired and needed cheering up'. It's these little touches of service from the staff that can elevate a hotel from the good to the excellent. We certainly appreciated the thoughtfulness.
reviews.title: Wonderful Staff

reviews.text: The room itself was quite spacious and extremely clean. One minor point was there was no tea or coffee making facilities in the room. There was free tea/coffee each day in the lobby first thing in the morning and free water in the room but it would have been nice to have the facility for a hot drink in the room on your return from a hard day out sightseeing.
reviews.title: Lovely and comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location of the hotel is excellent. Boston is a compact city that can be explored on foot but there is an efficient subway if you want to go further afield and there is a stop close to the hotel.
reviews.title: The perfect Boston Hotel

reviews.text: Special weekend for the family in the first week of December. I can truly say The Lennox Hotel and it's staff made this really special and memorable for us. The Hotel is fabulous architechturally, without the shabbiness you sometimes find in the older Hotels, the rooms are large, clean and in keeping with the style of the Hotel. The staff are friendly, efficient and nothing is too much trouble for them. I had e mailed a request for some items to be in the rooms before we arrived as a surprise for my family, this was done exactly as I had requested without any fuss or disclosure to my family. Brilliant.
reviews.title: Faultless in every way

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Lennox is one block away from Newbury St, 10 min walk from the common and 15min from the center of Boston or 2 min walk from the transit system. So the Lennox is within easy reach of every thing in Boston. Wouldn't now stay at any other Hotel in Boston.
reviews.title: Great Hotel Excellent Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you wish to eat in the Hotel Restaurant at a time convinient to you, book early, as it is pretty popular, although you are not short of places to eat in the area.
reviews.title: Quality Hotel in a great location

reviews.text: This is the best Hotel we have ever stayed in anywhere in the US. Honestly!
reviews.title: Fantastic customer service.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Lenox for four nights on a short break ,it is as has been said before a great hotel in an excellent location the staff were excellent throughout. We booked via Virgin Holidays it was cheaper tor us to take a package than book it ourselves. reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at The Lenox for 3 nights between Christmas and New Year. When we arrived we were told that the room booked for us was unavailble and that we were being upgraded. We were given a corner room on the 11th floor. It was very large and decorated beautifully throughout. The views from the room were good. The bed extremely large and comfortable. We ordered breakfast on the first morning and could find nothing to complain about, the food was plentiful and delicious. Every evening our bed was turned down, the light and radio left on to welcome us back to the room and a bar of Lindt chocolate left on the pillow, it is little touches like this that make the place extra special. Every member of staff that we spoke to was polite and extremely helpful. The business centre is free of charge (unusual these days). In all we could find nothing to complain about during our stay and would recommend this hotel to everyone. It is centrally located and we found it very easy to get around from here.
